ARTICLE.TITLE: FDLE: Mexico Beach officer-involved shooting was justified
ARTICLE.TEXT:
An officer-involved shooting in Mexico Beach has been deemed justified by the Florida Department of Law Enforcement.

In April, John Darlington, 57, was shot when Mexico Beach Police Officers went to arrest him on multiple warrants out of Pasco County. He was also wanted on grand theft charges in Franklin County.

They say Darlington was armed when he confronted officers. The officer who shot him was placed on administrative leave during the FDLE's investigation.

In July, FDLE officials released a report saying the officer's actions were lawful.
